question: Question_01_(e)
statement:
Write the second-order linear ODE

\[\displaystyle{} y'' + t y' + t^2 y = 0\]

as a first-order linear system.
sols:
We let
$\begin{pmatrix} y \\ y' \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix}$
so that

\begin{align*}
x_1' &= y' = x_2 \\
x_2' &= y'' = -ty' - t^2 y = -t x_2 - t^2 x_1
\end{align*}

We can now write the above in matrix notation
$\frac{d}{dt} \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ -t^2 & -t \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix}$.
This is a first-order linear system as requested.
